User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

Used Firefox like I normally do


Actual results:

#1 Why is it so fucking difficult to report a bug on Firefox? It only pisses me off more and I'm an avid user of Firefox solely because of the plugins. Now I'm just considering using Chrome.

#2 The longer Firefox stays open, the more memory is used up, sometimes often using up to 60% of my CPU usage as reported by my Task Manager (simply because I have to Ctrl + Alt + Delete) almost every 2 hours or so on Firefox because it takes over 5 minutes to close and reopen Firefox.

#3 Why does it take so long to close and reopen Firefox? 

#4 Why on multiple occasions, do multiple plugin-containers have to open as reported by my Task Manager (effectively reducing the performance of my computer) (I'm running Windows Vista 64-bit)

#5 Almost everytime I use Firefox, when I right-click anything, the right-click menu options are nonexistent and blinking as if theres some glitch. Very horrible and annoying.


Expected results:

Everything should have been fine. Firefox used to be awesome, what the heck happened? Please fix this. Don't turn into Internet Explorer.
